title: Autofill entries persist after being deleted
content:
For whatever reason Firefox decided it would save the redacted version of my bank ID.

Let's say my bank ID is 1234-ABCD. It has saved ******CD.

This requires me to delete it every time before accessing my account, which might be fine if selecting it then pressing delete didn't result in it re-autofilling, by the looks of things, or just ignoring the delete request.

I've deleted the erroneous entry from autofill, this has not solved the issue, and I have tried clearing that website in particular's cache; yet I'm greeted every time by the redacted version of the ID sitting in the text box, still requiring me to remove it twice before I can fill in the correct details without even having it saved in autofill.

I don't know what else to do. Any ideas?
creator: kaji.fox

title: Guam (USA) address autofill glitch
content:
I wrote to discogs.com support about a glitch on that site where autofilling my USA address always defaults to Guam (USA). This is what they said: Thank you for writing in! Sorry to hear of the difficulties here.

I was able to recreate the results you're receiving within Firefox, but was not able to recreate this within other browsers (Chrome, Safari), which were selecting the correct dropdown option (United States).

It appears this is an issue with how Firefox is interpreting our text fields, rather than a site bug. Autofill is a browser feature, rather than a site feature, and we unfortunately don't have the ability to modify which dropdown option Firefox selects when filling a free-text field.

For resolution, we would advise reporting this issue to Mozilla directly here:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/users/auth?next=%2Fen-US%2Fquestions%2Fnew%2Ffirefox%2Fform

If you have additional questions please let me know!

Is there anything to be done here? It's super annoying and discogs.com is not exactly a technical marvel.

Thanks d
creator: kobo8

title: Firefox 136.0.1 installation
content:
I updated Firefox from 136.0 to 136.0.1 last night. When I reloaded and checked the version number, I got the display "Firefox is being updated by another instance". I tried closing and reopening a few times but the result remained the same. I then rebooted the PC but no difference. I shutdown the PC and went to bed. This morning the issue was still there until I logged into my Mozilla account via google in order to type this message.. I checked the version number while typing and now it checked for updates and displays "Firefox is up to date".

So problem solved. Just curious why it happened?

Thanks

Gavin
creator: gavinpmelville

title: Recovering old data
content:
My laptop crashed and I had to format my hard and install new windows.

I have kept my passwords database files, which uses to be key3.db and key4.db along with logins.json and logins-backup.json files from my old use with me separately...

But the new Firefox folder didn't create these files anywhere where I could replace them with my files to get my stored passwords back.

Please help me restore my data from these files onto my new Firefox so I can get my stored passwords back.

title: How to remove old profile that has been hacked and stop it from syncing?
content: So very recently my main pc was hacked. Long story short, the best I could do was have my Microsoft account suspended. Now I am making new accounts for everything, including here. But my new account is attempting to sync with the old one. I don't want that to happen. I can't sign in to the old one to remove it since I can no longer access it. I am deathly afraid that this account will also be hacked due to it attempting to sync with the old one. Is that possible? And is there a way to remove the old one. I don't think my mind will be at ease till I can have a fresh start. I have requested Microsoft to completely delete the hacked account instead of simply suspending it, but I am unsure if that will do anything here.

title: css code for chrome files no longer works
content:
duplicate of /questions/1498770 thread

Recently (around Fx 134) css code for chrome files stopped working. The code I use is set out below. It previously changed the background colour to tan ( #dbc3a3 ), the text colour to dark blue ( #000080 ) and the font size to 17 px. The code found at the following location also no longer works for chrome files : https://gist.github.com/MrOtherGuy/c592f6443dd228022966cbe5715ad5c9

@-moz-document url-prefix("about:"), url-prefix("chrome://"), url-prefix("resource://"){ 

 :root {      --in-content-page-color: #000080 !important;      --in-content-text-color: #000080 !important;      --in-content-page-background: #dbc3a3 !important;      --in-content-box-background: #e2cfb6 !important;      --in-content-deemphasized-text: var(--in-content-text-color) !important;      scrollbar-color: #6495ed #d9d9d9 !important;       --background-color-box: var(--in-content-page-background) !important;      --text-color: var(--in-content-text-color) !important;            color:var(--in-content-text-color) !important;      --background-color-canvas: var(--in-content-page-background) !important;      --table-row-background-color-alternate: var(--in-content-box-background) !important;     
 menulist > menupopup{ background-color: var(--in-content-page-background) !important; }}}

@-moz-document url-prefix("chrome:") { 

 html, body, div, h1, p, table, td, tr { background-color: #dbc3a3 !important;    color: #000080 !important;    font-size: 17px !important; }  tr:hover { background-color: #b3d1ff !important; }  tr.odd:hover { background-color: #b3d1ff !important; }

}
creator: auckldr

title: I need a primary care doctor who is near my home and who will continue to care for me for a long time.
content:
My primary care doctor retired and I have been unable to find one since then. I have been to S. Anthony's on emergency basis and have pulmonary fibrosis which is improving. I made a decision not to use Ofev but am instead using herbs and doing rehab, planning a long term rehab program which is with one provide on line. I try to walk daily but don't always manage. I am easily fatigued mentally as a result of a brain injury in 1998 which still affects me.

I am hoping for a doctor who is intelligent, understands medications and various issues. I have had heart problems, both jaws replaced, also knee and other issues related to arthritis, so I have chronic pain, swelling in ankles, and other issues.

My records are at U of C hospital where I have gone for many years but now need to not go to numerous clinics across town. Nor do I want multiple providers. I'd love to do all the work everywhere.

I am late by almost two months for Prolia injection and saw a rheumatologist but her referral didn't count because she wasn't with U of C. She realized that a pt can't miss the injections for a year.

But in spite of all that, I want a compassionate primary care doctor that will listen and be there longer than just a brief time.

Will be doing serious pf rehab and exercise program as requested by pulmonologist.

I am a retired professor and still working as a professional writer. But I feel pretty helpless and uncomfortable in terms of getting medical health and hoping I will have more confidence with dr. at S. A. or Common Spirit. Thank you for your time and I appreciate you for reading all this and being a caring physician. Also, you are highly referred by a friend of mine.

Thanks, Linda
creator: horsemustang

title: ssa.gov link opens in new tab with error message
content: When I sign in to ssa.gov to see my personal record, the link takes me to a new tab with an error message. This does not happen on my mobile phone with Safari. I would like to use Firefox on my laptop but it will not let me access the Social Security link provided on their website. The URL: https://www.ssa.gov/personal-record When I click on "View your record"..."Sign in to view your earning record....." It opens a tab with this URL: https://secure.ssa.gov/RIL/SiView.action with the message: Bad Request Your browser sent a request that this server could not understand. Size of a request header field exceeds server limit. This must be a Firefox problem since Safari has no problem with this link. I prefer Firefox, so please help me find what the problem is so it can be fixed and I'll be able to use Firefox to access my Social Security account. Thank you!
